verses.verse: Come and let us return to Jehovah. For He has torn, and He will heal us. He has stricken, and He will bind us up.
After two days He will bring us to life. In the third day He will raise us up, and we shall live before Him.
And we shall know, we who follow on to know Jehovah. His going forth is prepared as the dawn. And He shall come to us as the rain, as the latter and former rain to the earth.
O Ephraim, what shall I do to you? O Judah, what shall I do to you? For your faithfulness is like a morning cloud, and it goes away like the early dew.
On account of this I have cut them down by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of My mouth; and your judgments have been as the light that goes forth.
For I desired faithfulness, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
But, like Adam, they have passed over the covenant; they have acted deceitfully against Me there.
Gilead is a city of those who work iniquity, slippery from blood.
And as troops of robbers wait for a man, the company of priests murder in the way to Shechem; for they have done wickedness.
I have seen a horrible thing in the house of Israel: the fornication of Ephraim is there; Israel is defiled.
Also, O Judah, a harvest is appointed to you, when I return the captivity of My people.
